page.title: 13CRAFTS IN L. STAUGHTON
page.content: Traditional{lace making}is still being practised in Little Staughton. It is made on a pillow filled either with hay, sawdust, or polystyrene. Cotton is wound on a bobbin with a shank at one end and a spangle made up of seven beads at the other, except for the Honiton bobbin which does not have this spangle.Bobbins used to be made of bone (often from the Christmas ham!) but are now usually made of plastic, brass or glass. The pattern is pricked onto the pillow from a parchment and paper pattern which is followed in the actual lace making. People from 8 to 80 years enjoy this ancient craft. {Cake icing and sugar craft}is also practised. Celebratory cakes of all kinds are made. They are richly decorated with flowers and other motifs.
